title: Trump and Harris neck-and-neck in NYT/Sienna poll: 'Voters don't know enough about her'
content: A new NYT/Sienna poll shows Donald Trump leading Kamala Harris by a slim margin, with Trump at 48% and Harris at 47%. This makes the upcoming debate crucial for Harris, as many voters still seek more information about her. Trump's support remains strong despite recent difficulties after a month of Democrats' enthusiasm over Kamala Harris' candidacy.
summary: A new NYT/Sienna poll shows Donald Trump leading Kamala Harris by a slim margin, with Trump at 48% and Harris at 47%. This makes the upcoming debate crucial for Harris, as many voters still seek more information about her. Trump's support remains strong despite recent difficulties after a month of Democrats' enthusiasm over Kamala Harris' candidacy.

title: 'Always the nasty man': Did Donald Trump mock Kamala Harris' height?
content: Donald Trump is around 6'2'' or 6'3'' (weight around 215 pounds/97.5 kg). Kamala Harris' height has some confusion as records claim that the vice president is 5'2'' but in an interview, Kamala said it was not true. "I am 5'4'' and a quarter -- something 5/4'' and a half. With heels, which I always wear, I', 5'7'' and a half," Kamala said. So even with heels, Kamala Harris will appear much shorter than Donald Trump.
summary: Donald Trump is around 6'2'' or 6'3'' (weight around 215 pounds/97.5 kg). Kamala Harris' height has some confusion as records claim that the vice president is 5'2'' but in an interview, Kamala said it was not true. "I am 5'4'' and a quarter -- something 5/4'' and a half. With heels, which I always wear, I', 5'7'' and a half," Kamala said. So even with heels, Kamala Harris will appear much shorter than Donald Trump.

title: Kamala Harris will be on right side of screen in debate with Trump. Like Biden was
content: Kamala Harris-Donald Trump debate: A coin flip was done on Tuesday which Trump won and got the privilege of choosing either podium placement or closing statement order. Trump chose to speak last and have Harris the podium placement. Kamala Harris will be on the right side of the screen, but left on the podium.
summary: Kamala Harris-Donald Trump debate: A coin flip was done on Tuesday which Trump won and got the privilege of choosing either podium placement or closing statement order. Trump chose to speak last and have Harris the podium placement. Kamala Harris will be on the right side of the screen, but left on the podium.

title: China expands foreign access, plans to allow foreign-owned hospitals in key urban centers
content: China is set to allow wholly foreign-owned hospitals in nine regions, including Beijing and Shanghai, to attract foreign investment and improve healthcare quality. The policy excludes traditional Chinese medicine hospitals and bars foreign mergers with public hospitals. Guidelines for establishing these hospitals will be released soon.
summary: China is set to allow wholly foreign-owned hospitals in nine regions, including Beijing and Shanghai, to attract foreign investment and improve healthcare quality. The policy excludes traditional Chinese medicine hospitals and bars foreign mergers with public hospitals. Guidelines for establishing these hospitals will be released soon.

title: George Bush won't endorse either Kamala Harris or Trump because...
content: It's no secret that Bush and Trump do not go along well and Trump built his political career partly by trashing the legacy of the Bush dynasty. Bush stopped endorsing anyone in the presidential election as Trump entered the race in 2016 but he never spoke against Trump. At a recent speech, when the November election was still between Trump and Biden, long-retired Bush said he was younger than both the candidates and yet too old.
summary: It's no secret that Bush and Trump do not go along well and Trump built his political career partly by trashing the legacy of the Bush dynasty. Bush stopped endorsing anyone in the presidential election as Trump entered the race in 2016 but he never spoke against Trump. At a recent speech, when the November election was still between Trump and Biden, long-retired Bush said he was younger than both the candidates and yet too old.

title: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan likely to face military trial, says defence minister Khawaja Asif
content: Pakistan's defence minister, Khawaja Asif, revealed that former Prime Minister Imran Khan could face a military trial due to mounting legal issues. Detained in Adiala Jail, Khan has filed a petition to halt the trial. The Supreme Court's recent ruling on military trials and ongoing legal debates complicate his situation further.
summary: Pakistan's defence minister, Khawaja Asif, revealed that former Prime Minister Imran Khan could face a military trial due to mounting legal issues. Detained in Adiala Jail, Khan has filed a petition to halt the trial. The Supreme Court's recent ruling on military trials and ongoing legal debates complicate his situation further.

title: Watch: Man steals tow truck, damages multiple cars in Brooklyn
content: An enraged man in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, stole a tow truck after seeing his vehicle being towed. Following a physical altercation with the tow truck driver, he drove recklessly, damaging several cars and crashing into a city bus. The man abandoned the truck and fled on foot. Authorities are actively searching for him.
summary: An enraged man in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, stole a tow truck after seeing his vehicle being towed. Following a physical altercation with the tow truck driver, he drove recklessly, damaging several cars and crashing into a city bus. The man abandoned the truck and fled on foot. Authorities are actively searching for him.

title: Two sisters, aged 2 and 4, drown in Long Island pond after mother falls asleep
content: Two young sisters, aged 2 and 4, lost their lives after drowning in a pond behind their Long Island apartment complex in New York State. The incident occurred around 3:15 pm on Saturday. They were found shortly after being reported missing and pronounced dead at Stony Brook University Hospital. Authorities are currently investigating the case.
summary: Two young sisters, aged 2 and 4, lost their lives after drowning in a pond behind their Long Island apartment complex in New York State. The incident occurred around 3:15 pm on Saturday. They were found shortly after being reported missing and pronounced dead at Stony Brook University Hospital. Authorities are currently investigating the case.

title: 'Not a fact': Tim Walz criticises JD Vance's remark on school shootings
content: Governor Tim Walz criticized JD Vance's comments on school shootings being unavoidable. Speaking at the Human Rights Campaign National Dinner, he underscored the importance of school safety and LGBTQ+ rights. Walz outlined his agenda with Vice President Kamala Harris, focusing on reducing taxes for working families and passing the Equality Act to ban discrimination.
summary: Governor Tim Walz criticized JD Vance's comments on school shootings being unavoidable. Speaking at the Human Rights Campaign National Dinner, he underscored the importance of school safety and LGBTQ+ rights. Walz outlined his agenda with Vice President Kamala Harris, focusing on reducing taxes for working families and passing the Equality Act to ban discrimination.

title: Spain to grant asylum to Venezuelan opposition leader Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia
content: Spain's foreign minister confirmed that asylum will be provided to Venezuelan opposition leader Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia. After challenging President Maduro's re-election and facing an arrest warrant, Gonzalez sought refuge in the Spanish embassy in Caracas. He left Venezuela on a Spanish military aircraft, with safe passage granted by the Maduro government for political peace.
summary: Spain's foreign minister confirmed that asylum will be provided to Venezuelan opposition leader Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia. After challenging President Maduro's re-election and facing an arrest warrant, Gonzalez sought refuge in the Spanish embassy in Caracas. He left Venezuela on a Spanish military aircraft, with safe passage granted by the Maduro government for political peace.

title: 'Exceptional young man': Florida high school football player Chance Gainer dies after collapsing during game
content: Chance Gainer, an 18-year-old high school football player from Florida, tragically collapsed and died during a game in Georgia. He had recently visited Vanderbilt University with hopes of playing football there. Gainer scored two touchdowns before his sudden death. The cause of his collapse remains unknown as authorities investigate.
summary: Chance Gainer, an 18-year-old high school football player from Florida, tragically collapsed and died during a game in Georgia. He had recently visited Vanderbilt University with hopes of playing football there. Gainer scored two touchdowns before his sudden death. The cause of his collapse remains unknown as authorities investigate.

title: 'Harry still has an anchor in the UK’: Prince’s 'secret' connection with family members
content: Prince Harry remains in touch with his late mother Princess Diana's family despite estrangement from Prince William and King Charles. He attended Lady Jane Fellowes' husband's funeral and stayed at Althorp House with uncle Charles Spencer. Additionally, he maintains a good relationship with cousin Princess Beatrice, who is mediating between him and William.
summary: Prince Harry remains in touch with his late mother Princess Diana's family despite estrangement from Prince William and King Charles. He attended Lady Jane Fellowes' husband's funeral and stayed at Althorp House with uncle Charles Spencer. Additionally, he maintains a good relationship with cousin Princess Beatrice, who is mediating between him and William.

title: US President Biden spent 532 days away from office, took 48 years worth of leave in 4 years
content: US President Joe Biden has spent 532 days on vacation in less than four years, far exceeding his predecessors. Critics argue that his frequent absences neglect key issues such as inflation and border security. While aides assert he works remotely during vacations, public images of him relaxing have sparked debate about balancing presidential duties with personal time off.
summary: US President Joe Biden has spent 532 days on vacation in less than four years, far exceeding his predecessors. Critics argue that his frequent absences neglect key issues such as inflation and border security. While aides assert he works remotely during vacations, public images of him relaxing have sparked debate about balancing presidential duties with personal time off.

title: Why Venezuelan opposition ex-Presidential candidate fled the country: Key details
content: Venezuelan opposition leader Edmundo Gonzalez has sought asylum in Spain after hiding due to an arrest warrant following disputed presidential election results favoring Nicolás Maduro. Venezuela granted him safe conduct to leave the country, emphasizing adherence to international law and aiming for political peace amid ongoing diplomatic tensions with Brazil.
summary: Venezuelan opposition leader Edmundo Gonzalez has sought asylum in Spain after hiding due to an arrest warrant following disputed presidential election results favoring Nicolás Maduro. Venezuela granted him safe conduct to leave the country, emphasizing adherence to international law and aiming for political peace amid ongoing diplomatic tensions with Brazil.

title: Georgia shooter suspect's mother called school minutes before shooting, warned of ‘extreme emergency’
content: Marcee Gray alerted a school counselor about her son Colt before the Georgia school shooting occurred. A text message from Colt led Marcee to contact the school. The shooting at Apalachee High School resulted in four fatalities and nine injuries. Both Colt and his father are facing serious legal charges.
summary: Marcee Gray alerted a school counselor about her son Colt before the Georgia school shooting occurred. A text message from Colt led Marcee to contact the school. The shooting at Apalachee High School resulted in four fatalities and nine injuries. Both Colt and his father are facing serious legal charges.

title: Australia's 2026 census to include LGBTIQ+ identity questions following public outrage
content: For the first time, Australia's 2026 census will include optional questions on sexual orientation and gender for individuals aged 16 and above. This decision follows controversy over their initial exclusion. Government officials emphasise that this change aims to ensure representation of the LGBTIQ+ community, reflecting their importance in national statistics.
summary: For the first time, Australia's 2026 census will include optional questions on sexual orientation and gender for individuals aged 16 and above. This decision follows controversy over their initial exclusion. Government officials emphasise that this change aims to ensure representation of the LGBTIQ+ community, reflecting their importance in national statistics.

title: Chinese man dies after working for 104 days with 1 day off, company held liable
content: A'bao, a 30-year-old painter, succumbed to multiple organ failure after an exhausting work schedule of 104 days with only one day off. The court ruled that the company was 20% responsible and ordered compensation for his family. His work conditions violated Chinese Labour Law's regulations on working hours.
summary: A'bao, a 30-year-old painter, succumbed to multiple organ failure after an exhausting work schedule of 104 days with only one day off. The court ruled that the company was 20% responsible and ordered compensation for his family. His work conditions violated Chinese Labour Law's regulations on working hours.

title: ‘We're run by stupid people’: Trump calls for Constitutional change to remove 'conspiring' vice presidents
content: Donald Trump proposed amending the 25th Amendment to remove a vice president who covers up a president's incapacity. This call was made during a campaign rally in Wisconsin, in response to Joe Biden's poor debate performance and his subsequent withdrawal from the presidential race, which left Kamala Harris as the Democratic nominee.
summary: Donald Trump proposed amending the 25th Amendment to remove a vice president who covers up a president's incapacity. This call was made during a campaign rally in Wisconsin, in response to Joe Biden's poor debate performance and his subsequent withdrawal from the presidential race, which left Kamala Harris as the Democratic nominee.

title: Raging wildfire forces evacuations in US' San Bernardino as temperatures cross triple digits
content: A wildfire in the San Bernardino National Forest near Los Angeles has prompted evacuations as temperatures hit 112°F. The Line Fire, igniting Thursday evening, has burned through 11 square miles of vegetation. Over 500 firefighters are on the scene with air support. Officials warn of potential significant fire growth within the next 12 hours.
summary: A wildfire in the San Bernardino National Forest near Los Angeles has prompted evacuations as temperatures hit 112°F. The Line Fire, igniting Thursday evening, has burned through 11 square miles of vegetation. Over 500 firefighters are on the scene with air support. Officials warn of potential significant fire growth within the next 12 hours.

title: US believes Iran has transferred short-range ballistic missiles to Russia
content: The US believes Iran has transferred short-range ballistic missiles to Russia for its war in Ukraine, raising concerns about escalating conflict and European security threats. The White House reiterates warnings against such transfers, while Iran denies supplying weapons, calling for a ceasefire instead. CIA Director highlights troubling defense relationships involving Russia, China, Iran, and North Korea.
summary: The US believes Iran has transferred short-range ballistic missiles to Russia for its war in Ukraine, raising concerns about escalating conflict and European security threats. The White House reiterates warnings against such transfers, while Iran denies supplying weapons, calling for a ceasefire instead. CIA Director highlights troubling defense relationships involving Russia, China, Iran, and North Korea.
